result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan W Kowalski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 20 days; alternate 7 days jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jonathan W Kowalski in court with attorney Christopher Ehrfurth for attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend to county ordinance disorderly conduct 13-102(c)(8) and dismiss and read in count 2.  No contest plea entered.  Court dismisses and reads in count 2.  Court imposes a fine of $363.50, alternate 7 days jail, 20 days to pay.

Defendant Jonathan W Kowalski in court with attorney Christopher Ehrfurth for attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ehrfurth requests an adjournment for disposition.  Court adjourns.  Hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Jonathan W Kowalski in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:15 am.
